result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher Steven Mattice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristopher Steven Mattice is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristopher Steven Mattice was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Kristopher Steven Mattice appeared from jail. Case called at 4:33 pm. Atty Caton recites agreement. No objection from ADA Kelly.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #2 in 15CF519. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 in 15CF519. Court dismisses Count #1 in 15CF519. Court dismisses Count #1 in 15CF587. Count #2 in 15CF587 is dismissed and read in for restitution. Atty's make sentencing arguments. Court orders: 
17 Days Jail. Credit for 17 Days.
- Court Costs $253.00
- DNA Sample  and Surcharge $200.00
- Restitution: $53.01
Payment Plan Approved

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _x Defendant andguarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2250.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- Includes 15CF519 and 15CF587

- Bond to be paid by March 30th, 2016

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, BP Gas Station in Woodville WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Kristopher Steven Mattice appeared from jail. Includes 15CF519 and 15CF587. Case called at 11:06 am. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds Def has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the Def probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bail Jumping on Charges in Cippewa County. Atty Caton requests a Signature Bond.  Arraignment scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Deiss, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll, NONA by def. Case called at 10:44 am. Court reviews file. Set for PH on 15CF519 and INIT on 15CF587. Court reviews file. ADA Correll requests warrant. Court issues warrant on both files with adjoining states. km
Preliminary hearing at 12-28-2015 10:30 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, BP Gas Station in Woodville WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
